channel.title: How do you get the top of a Java app to look like irc?
channel.description:
Well, on irc instead of the standard windows bar at the top its light blue, and has a bumpy texture, i wondered about this for a while but never bothered to ask. I only managed to get it like that when i used a internal frame.
this is what it looks like at the top of my java apps atm. [img]http://img470.imageshack.us/img470/4934/bluebarxh3.png[/img]
this is how i want it to look [img]http://img253.imageshack.us/img253/8452/bbluerj1.png[/img]

item.title: How do you get the top of a Java app to look like irc?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

† Java †, under your class line, add

JFrame frame;

And in the constructor;

frame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get the top of a Java app to look like irc?

item.title: How do you get the top of a Java app to look like irc?
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“pizza pie, post:24, topic:120560”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=170122.msg1578929#msg1578929 date=1183893063]

yea, if you have any doubts, just make it the first line in main() or init()

[/quote]
quote urself? rofl better than saying it again huh lol

okay ontopic, i need help with this too, ive been wondering about this for a long, long time, ever since i started coding apps :), ill try it right now

put it before any JFrame[/quote]They’ve already said how to do it D:

item.source: How do you get the top of a Java app to look like irc?

item.title: How do you get the top of a Java app to look like irc?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[code]
import javax.swing.*;

public class Class1 extends JFrame
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);
new Class1();

}

public Class1()
{
this.setSize(300, 300);
this.setTitle(“Test”);
this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
this.setVisible(true);
}

}
[/code]try that

Read full topic

item.title: How do you get the top of a Java app to look like irc?
item.dc:creator: @_Java1 † Java †
item.description:
@_Java1 wrote:

It doesnt work =\

i tested it using a java file and JDK…
heres what i have in the file…

import javax.swing.*;

public class Class1 extends JFrame
{
  public static void main(String[] args)
  {

  new Class1();

  }

public Class1() 
{
          JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(false);
         this.setSize(300, 300);
         this.setTitle("Test");
         this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);

this.setVisible(true);
}

}

item.title: How do you get the top of a Java app to look like irc?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

frank_:

before you make any gui related objects, JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true)

frank_ is almost right, but it seems to me you want the java app to look like a normal window, so you would put:

JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(false);

Or just not put it at all, since false is default.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you get the top of a Java app to look like irc?
